description: This 180-km route near Powell River, BC, extends from Sarah Point to Saltery Bay. It has huts for shared public use (you don't have to carry a tent), and weaves through old-growth forests, up panoramic mountains, and along coastal shorelines. Use this guidebook to plan a day hike, an overnight trip, or a multi-day along the whole trail. Includes 30 trail descriptions and maps, hut access information, details about access and exits, an elevation chart, GPS waypoints, and a description of the Troubridge Trudge.
name: The Sunshine Coast Trail 5th Edition
